author: Sean McLain
title: Nissan Revs Up Electric Vehicle Sales Target
text:
YOKOHAMA, Japan—Nissan Motor Co. aims to sharply increase its electric vehicle sales over the next five years, leaning on the expected explosion of sales of battery-powered vehicles in China.

In an ambitious bet on future demand, the Japanese auto maker said Friday that it aims to sell one million battery-powered vehicles per annum through the financial year ending March 2023. Nissan’s sales target includes both pure electric vehicles—like its popular Leaf, which sold some 73,000 units in 2017—and new e-Power hybrid gasoline-electric...
